events.mixins module#

class events.mixins.EventMixin#

Bases: django.contrib.auth.mixins.LoginRequiredMixin, django.contrib.auth.mixins.PermissionRequiredMixin, django.views.generic.base.ContextMixin

Mixin for Event views. For Permission : This mixin check if the user has the permission required OR if allow_manager is true and the user is the manager of the event. Then, it check if the event exists. Then, if it is not already done.

Also, add to context the event itself.

allow_manager = False#
get_context_data(**kwargs)#
has_permission()#

Check if event exists, then permission. Then check potentially on-going / manager attributes

need_ongoing_event = False#
permission_required = None#

manager#

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

manager_id#
objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>#
pay_by_ponderation(operator, recipient, ponderation_price)#

Procde au paiement de lvenement par les participants. Une seule vente, un seul paiement mais plusieurs dbits sur compte (un par participant) :param operator: user qui procde au paiement :param recipient: user qui recoit les paiements (AE_ENSAM) :param ponderation_price: price per ponderation for each participant :return:

pay_by_total(operator, recipient, total_price)#

Procde au paiement de lvenement par les participants. Une seule vente, un seul paiement mais plusieurs dbits sur compte (un par participant) :param operator: user qui procde au paiement :param recipient: user qui recoit les paiements (AE_ENSAM) :return:

remove_user(user)#

Suppresion de lutilisateur, purement et simplement, de lvnement. :param user: user supprimer :return:

users#

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

weightsuser_set#

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

class events.views.EventChangeWeight#

Bases: events.mixins.EventMixin, borgia.views.BorgiaView

allow_manager = True#
get(request, *args, **kwargs)#

Change la valeur de la pondration dun participant user pour un vnement Permissions : Si vnements termin -> denied,

Si pas manager ou pas la perm finances.change_event -> denied

Parameters

  • pk pk de lvnement

  • user_pk paramtre GET correspondant au pk de luser

  • pond_pk paramtre GET correspondant la nouvelle pondration

class events.views.EventFinish#

Bases: events.mixins.EventMixin, borgia.views.BorgiaFormView

Finish a event and redirect to the list of events. This command is used when you want to keep the event in the database, but you dont want to pay in Borgia (for instance paid with real money).

Parameters

  • kwargs['group_name'] name of the group used.

  • kwargs['pk'] pk of the event

  • self.perm_codename codename of the permission checked.

form_class#

alias of events.forms.EventFinishForm

If the form is valid, redirect to the supplied URL.

Insert the form into the context dict.

get_initial()#

Populate the form with the current price.

has_permission()#

Check if event exists, then permission. Then check potentially on-going / manager attributes. Then, check if there at least one participant.

need_ongoing_event = True#

success_message = "'%(description)s' a bien t termin."#
